body.para: That is because I am the only moderator and I was on vacation. I did ask a couple people to take over or help with moderation, but have no response (I just asked a few hours ago, so I'm not giving up), but if there are others that would like to help with this, speak up.

The scarab issues are a problem because they are sent from the specific user, but they often are not subscribed to the list. I have added some that seem active so that they are allowed posters, but whenever a new user creates an issue it needs moderation.

We started moderating the issues list because it did start receiving spam though it has not been much. I would not classify it as enough to warrant the moderation difficulty, but others might unsubscribe immediately after getting some porn or other potentially offensive material, so I have left it moderated.
On Mon, 2003-12-01 at 13:27, Peter Ledbrook wrote:

quote.quotepara: I've noticed that a few new issues have been added to the self-hosted Scarab issue tracker, yet no e-mails have appeared in the issues mailing list. The same is true for comments added to existing issues. Anyone know what's going on? This only seems to happen with certain (new?) users, since my changes are triggering e-mails correctly.
